item.title: Crashing Servers - is a good way to get banned from the forums
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:32, topic:324511”][quote author=licorish55 link=topic=420905.msg3092998#msg3092998 date=1263055910]

[quote author=Lin link=topic=420905.msg3092710#msg3092710 date=1263018147]

It’s called 3 connections per IP, and IP ban.
[/quote]I’m sorry, but I lol’d.

Why?

[/quote]All you have to do is flood the server with connections. It still has something to process, and the way it’s programmed, if you flood it fast enough, it will crash.[/quote]So you mean a SyiPkPker?

item.title: Crashing Servers - is a good way to get banned from the forums
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

xxlukexx:

not enough is happening with them, they either get moderated or muted… when they can easily wait a few days to get unmuted or warned…or they can make a new account…

It’s hardly a serious problem is it? As long as they are punished appropriately, it’s not going to be an issue. If a member is new and advertises a server, it should be an instant ban. If they’re an older member they should be warned, moderated or muted depending on the situation.

When you see an advertisement all you have to do is ignore it and report it to a moderator, but as usual a big scene is made.

relmitos:

It’s not always a server’s representee who is mass advertising.

Exactly.

Read full topic

item.source: Crashing Servers - is a good way to get banned from the forums

item.title: Crashing Servers - is a good way to get banned from the forums
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“licorish55, post:19, topic:324511”][quote author=inertia link=topic=420905.msg3091921#msg3091921 date=1262964948]
It may seem right, to most people, to punish those inappropriately advertising their servers by attacking them. It sets a bad atmosphere though, and these people will simply attack the person who attacked them first, or take it out on other random servers because they feel they’ve been unfairly treated. If the upper echelon of the community decide a server should be attacked, then the site/server is definitely going to get it back.

So no, I don’t think attacking them is the right answer. They need to be punished in other ways such as by censorship, muting, or even banning.
[/quote]

Yeah, because spammers care SO DEARLY about their account with 1 post.

They’ll just go and make another one.[/quote]
Unfortunately they wouldn’t be able to advertise a censored server, even if they did get through the (ip) ban hammer.

Read full topic
item.source: Crashing Servers - is a good way to get banned from the forums

[quote=“inertia, post:18, topic:324511”]It may seem right, to most people, to punish those inappropriately advertising their servers by attacking them. It sets a bad atmosphere though, and these people will simply attack the person who attacked them first, or take it out on other random servers because they feel they’ve been unfairly treated. If the upper echelon of the community decide a server should be attacked, then the site/server is definitely going to get it back.

So no, I don’t think attacking them is the right answer. They need to be punished in other ways such as by censorship, muting, or even banning.[/quote]

Yeah, because spammers care SO DEARLY about their account with 1 post.

They’ll just go and make another one.

item.title: Crashing Servers - is a good way to get banned from the forums
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

It may seem right, to most people, to punish those inappropriately advertising their servers by attacking them. It sets a bad atmosphere though, and these people will simply attack the person who attacked them first, or take it out on other random servers because they feel they’ve been unfairly treated. If the upper echelon of the community decide a server should be attacked, then the site/server is definitely going to get it back.

So no, I don’t think attacking them is the right answer. They need to be punished in other ways such as by censorship, muting, or even banning.

Read full topic
